results.title: Death railway (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Death Railway, portrays the heroism and solidarity of the Australian troops during World War 11. Using scenes of the railway today, authentic archival footage from Australian and Japanese sources, the drawings of Sir Edward Dunlop, and present day interviews, the film covers the route the railway took up the Kwai Noi Valley, between Rangoon and Bangkok. 116,000 Australians, British and Dutch lost their lives building the railway.

results.title: Death railway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visions of War”.
World War II prisoners of war recall building the infamous narrow-gauge railway through the almost impenetrable, disease infested jungles between Rangoon and Bangkok. Over 116,000 Australians, British, and Dutch lost their lives. Was this infamous railway a military necessity or a monument to brutality? The survivors (including Sir Edward Dunlop) tell a story of courage and resourcefulness in the face of a hostile environment and a ruthless enemy. Rare archival film was used in the compiling of this documentary, including a Japanese propaganda film on the treatment of prisoners of war. Contains some scenes in b&w. Narrated by Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: Death railway
results.creator_credit: Bilcock and Copping Film Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: Examines the building of the 280 mile long narrow gauge Bangkok to Rangoon Railway during the 1940’s, on which 116,000 World War II prisoners died. A number of POW’s, including Dr ‘Weary’ Dunlop who worked on the railway and survived provide valuable reminiscences of the hardships endured, meagre food rations, lack of medical facilities, the use of a wood saw to amputate limbs and tropical ulcers. The relics of a nightmare railway line are still visible in remote reaches of Thailand’s jungle. David Bilcock and his film crew retrace the steps of the soldiers who perished building the line that was to be bombed during its first week of operation. Includes footage of the Japanese attack on Malaya and Singapore and the setting up of Changi Prison. Narrated by Gerrard Kennedy. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Death on the Nile
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone, John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and John Guillermin
results.brief_description: A star-studded cast features in this version of a great Agatha Christie classic story. Peter Ustinov stars as the famous Belgian detective Hercule Poirot investigating the murder of rich American heiress Lynette Ridgeway on board a Nile steamer. All the passengers including her newly acquired husband have reason to want her dead and it is Poirot who puts “his little grey cells” to work and solves the mystery. Beautifully costumed, starring Jane Birkin, Lois Chiles, Bette Davis, Mia Farrow, Jon Finch, Olivia Hussey, I.S. Johar, George Kennedy, Angela Lansbury, Simon MacCorkindale, David Niven, Maggie Smith and Jack Warden.

results.title: Death of a student
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Brian Armstrong
results.brief_description: Compiled from footage shot surreptitiously by Granada Television’s World in Action Unit and an underground Czech filmmaker. Records the events that were taking place on the streets of Prague following the death of 21 year old Jan Palach, the first Czech student who set himself alight as a protest against censorship and Soviet occupation of his country. From his deathbed, he sent a message to his compatriots hoping to rouse them into action against their oppressors. He died on the 19th of January 1969, 73 hours after setting himself on fire. The film documents the street vigils occuring while Palach was in hospital, the demonstration organised the day after his death and the tributes and ceremonies that marked his funeral which was attended by half a million people. A musical lament interspersed with the sound of Soviet tanks was composed for Palach’s death and edited with footage of his funeral. Includes vox populi interviews and a visit by the film unit to Palach’s philosophy class at Prague University. Cinematography for Granada Television by Ian McFarlane. Edited by Gerry Dow, Jeremy Wallington and Leslies Woodhead.

results.title: Death of a salesman [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roxbury and Punch, Robert F. Colesberry and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: This play, written by Arthur Miller, is one of the enduring glories of the American theatre. This adaptation was filmed within the confines of a Broadway stage set, thereby enhancing the intimacy of the study of the disintegration of the travelling salesman. Flashbacks are adroitly interwoven with the current scenes, providing a build-up to the shattering climax. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman and John Malkovich.

results.title: Death of a Neapolitan mathematician
results.creator_credit: Teatri Uniti, Angelo Curti and Mario Martone
results.brief_description: Naples in 1959, a society entrenched in cynicism, is the setting for the final sceneds in the life of Renato Caccioppoli - a brilliant intellectual, admired academic and political non-conformist. His rejection of Italian society that lacks social and political will is implicit in his actions, whilst his tolerance towards everything and everyone that surrounds him is diminishing fast. The film follows the mathematician’s last week, from his arrest as a vagrant in a railway station, to his release and his bitter farewell to his friends and beloved. Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Death of a legend
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: The Wolf is an endangered species in Canada, threatened by man and his technology, largely because of unfounded myths that have grown up around it. This study attempts to disprove the fallacies, showing the wolf’s life cycle, the social organisation of the pack and the wolf’s role in maintaining the balance of nature. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Brussels)

results.title: Death of a bureaucrat = La Muerte de un burocrata
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), Margarita Alexandre and Tomas Gutierrez Alea
results.brief_description: This film is an uproarious comedy and a masterpiece of film satire. A model worker who invented a machine for manufacturing plaster busts of Cuban national hero Jose Marti, dies in an accident while working on the machine. He is buried holding his “carnet laboral” (labour card) as a symbol of his proletarian pride. The widow, upon applying for a pension, discovers that it cannot be processed without first turning in the card. In the film, the story has been elaborated to provide innumerable opportunities to parody Hollywood comedy. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Salvador Wood, Manuel Estanillo, Silvia Planas and Gaspar de Santelices.

results.title: Death of a beauty = Mei ren zhi si
results.creator_credit: Tianshan Film Studio and Guang Chunlan
results.brief_description:
The film is based on an ancient legend taking place in Southern Xinjiang three hundred years ago. Mariam and her father lived in an old mansion. One day Mariam was singing on the balcony and her cousin incidentally saw her unveiled face, which terribly scared him. What had happened to Mariam was that two years ago when her father was seriously ill, he made a will saying that Mariam would inherit all his wealth. This enraged Mariam’s stepmother, who set a fire on the house and Mariam’s face was severely disfigured. Mariam’s stepmother had since controlled the mansion. During the Corban festival, the royal family, Yunus came to visit Mariam’s father. The prince, Kaisal surprisingly found out that the veiled Mariam was the little girl that he met on a hunting five years ago. Kaisal promised that he would marry Mariam. Soon Kaisal’s father sent people to propose the marriage, which put Mariam’s father into a difficult situation. Mariam’s stepmother drove Mariam off and made their servant, Palida pretend to be the bride. The kind-hearted Palida told Kaisal the truth and poisoned herself. Kaisal was furious about what had happened and went to look for Mariam. Kaisal found Mariam eventually but Mariam jumped off the cliff as she saw Kaisal running towards her. She did not want the prince to marry her who were no longer the girl he had met. Mariam’s stepmother died in a fire and the film ends in Kaisal holding Mariam walking on the desert in the sunset.

The film is directed by a female director, Guang Chunlan. Guang also produced The Mysterious Caravan (1985), The Girl Who Wanted to Dance (1983) and so on in the Tianshan Film Studio. Throughout the 1980s, Guang made a number of films representing the rich local culture and lifestyles in Xinjiang. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)
